website_summaries.verdict: While it's no small appliance, this purifier's ability to clean the air makes it worth it. If you have pets or allergies, it's a must-have.
pros: Four different cleaning levels so you can choose how powerful (and loud) you want the purifier to be
Circulates air in a room five times per hour
cons: Not everyone found the touchscreen panel easy to use or particularly responsive

customer_reviews.title: Terrible odor
customer_reviews.text: Honeywell apparently has a new supplier for replacement filters and it is now impossible to purchase replacement filters that do not produce a terrible odor. Great unit now rendered useless. If you are purchasing to remove odors, find another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Sol

customer_reviews.title: You must use THREE hepa filters every time you change your hepa filters on the HPA-300
customer_reviews.text: I can't really review the product as I just recieved it. However, there is something that I found greatly deceptive. When I purchased the Honeywell HPA 300 foot extra large rooms I also purchased THREE hepa filters and FOUR pre filters. Except you use ONE pre filter when you change the filters and ALL THREE hepa filters in one change. The pre filters supposedly only last 2-3 months and the hepa filter lasts UP TO one year. Sorry Honeywell, you make the most money on replacement filters and rather than make ONE SINGLE Hepa filter, you make three separate ones to fool the consumer into buying the product and the replacement packs. To me, that spells a dishonest business transaction.
customer_reviews.author: M. Saxe

customer_reviews.title: 45 days old and starting to sound like an outboard motor--I expected a lot better for the ...
customer_reviews.text: 45 days old and starting to sound like an outboard motor--I expected a lot better for the price and from Honeywell.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY AMAZON CHARGES $39 RESTOCKING FEE FOR RETURN
customer_reviews.text: I agree that this must be made in cheap china factory. My first unit worked well for a week then started to fill the room with toxic plastic smell. I ordered a replacement and the unit smelled of plastic from the get go that would not go away. I returned it and amazon gave me $40 less. I did not see anywhere on the purchase or initiating a return that I would be charged a restocking fee. BUYER BEWARE.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Arrived broken.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived broken. Fan made loud clonking noise when initially turned on then just stopped. Returned Immediately - annoyed that I didn't find this out until after opening all filters and setting up.
customer_reviews.author: dawn

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but poor design for replacing filters - cheap plastic
customer_reviews.text: Works well. It is noisy but I’ve gotten used to it. My only complaint is the poor design when having to replace the filters. The front snaps off and it is very hard to secure it once the filter is replaced. It is a cheap plastic. We had to put duct tape on the sides to keep the front grill in place. We’ve had it for 2 years now and with 3 kitties, we change the filters often. The front has become loose and will fall off.
customer_reviews.author: firekracker

customer_reviews.title: Need to air out this stinky beast
customer_reviews.text: I slammed this product in my first review because of the toxic plastic odor it emitted. A product representative responded to my complaint. He suggested putting the filter outside under cover and let it run 24 hours. After more like 36 hours, the odor mostly disappeared. Would I buy this product again? I'm not sure yet. If I had bought this at a brick and mortar store, it would have been returned without hesitation, no second chances. I suggest that the description should include information about start up recommendations. Now it's a matter of what kind of service it provides.
customer_reviews.author: Reggie

customer_reviews.title: High Pitched Whine
customer_reviews.text: I'm so annoyed right now... I am trying to find a good Air Purifier for my house, because my cat has such bad allergies that he breathes only from his mouth. Also sneezing out snot, I can hear him from across the house when he tries to breathe through his nose. I got this one because of all the good reviews on here, yet within about 12 hours of this running, there is now a high pitched sound I can hear on another level of the house. It would be nice if I can find a good air purifier that isn't going to cost me 800 dollars, and also doesn't whine while being run.
customer_reviews.author: Wolfenacht

customer_reviews.title: WARNING
customer_reviews.text: This product stopped working after just 2 months. For warranty work, I will have to pay for shipping the 21# air purifier + pay $10 for its return shipping. It was great when it was working but is now a piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: CNK

customer_reviews.title: Smells terrible, not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: This worked well for 20 days, it sounded nice and smooth and pushed a lot of air. Now I'm returning it because of these two main reasons. 1) sounds like crap now 2) smells so terrible, it's a metallic smell. Maybe new filters would make it smell better again but I took the filters out and the smell lingers in the machine, plus I'm not going to spend a fortune buying new filters every 20 days... I'm returning thus before more goes wrong with it....smells groooooosssssss
customer_reviews.author: Akil Al-Darraji

customer_reviews.title: Poor long term quality
customer_reviews.text: This product was great when I initially bought it. About a year and a half after owning it though the buttons barley work, and it switches settings intermittently. If you press the power button sometimes it turns on sometimes not. Then it will occasionally turn it self off, or switch power settings and I’m no where near it. Maybe I got a bad batch, but for me I wouldn’t buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Bryce Deneen

customer_reviews.title: Defective Design.  Do Not Buy!  Worse than shoddy. Times TWO!
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these. Liked it so much I bought another. The second one lasted two weeks. The power switch completely failed. Sent it back and I got a third. This one lasted but 11 weeks. Again, the power switch completely failed. The switch is some touch switch and breaks quickly. Worse than shoddy! Now, the second of three has failed in the same way. They'll replace it but you have to get your own box and pay $80 for shipping. This one's just going to the dump.
customer_reviews.author: woodsroamer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible fumes from plastic of air purifier.
customer_reviews.text: Bought what I thought was same item 2 yrs ago and have loved it. Honeywell has changed the materials they used on this latest model and it gives off so many fumes it stinks up the whole room. Instead of helping clean the air it causes headaches, watery eyes and coughing. Probably formaldehyde....dangerous to livers and possible carcinogin. Do not buy this.
customer_reviews.author: sharon jones

customer_reviews.title: The AirGenius 5 is better
customer_reviews.text: I thought this one would be better, but the AirGenius 5 works more efficiently. This one blows air on the top whereas the AirGenius 5 blows in front like a fan and has an option to oscillate. I feel like the air is fresher in the room where I keep my AirGenius 5.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE - PRODUCT STOPPED WORKING 3 MONTHS IN.
customer_reviews.text: BUYER BEWARE!!!!!!!!! This product worked amazingly well for the first 3 months or so only to completely stop working. I cant seem to get power to the unit at all. I cant return it to Amazon and I need to ship this monstrosity back to the manufacturer ( on my dime ) to see if it can be fixed or replaced under the warranty. What a joke! I expected much better. So very disappointed - spent over $200 for this piece of garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Allyxander

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: I had to get the largest one for our open floor plan house. It’s very quiet. And I paid a little more for the white one because I wanted it to blend in up against our white brick fireplace that is two sided and sits in the middle of the large space. It works great! I have a Cockatoo that bothers my allergies and was pretty miserable at first. Then I got this and two smaller ones for the bedroom and her room. I’ve been fine now for a more than a month! Worth the expense for me.
customer_reviews.author: TexasGigi

customer_reviews.title: Awful Smell!
customer_reviews.text: I should have listened to all your reviews. I chose instead to listen to Consumer Reports who recommends this product. Big mistake! I turned my purifier on and immediately a very strong deodorant like smell came out. I let it run for an hour to see if it would go away. It just got worse. I started coughing and turned it off. I called Amazon to ask for product help. I was told that maybe the purifier had been owned by someone else first! What? I am returning it and buying a different air purifier. Listen to all the reviews that say it has a bad smell.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: This thing is amazing, and worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing, and worth every penny. I have terrible allergies, and a cat I'm allergic to. My boyfriend is extremely allergic to cats, to the point he can't stay at my house. We figured we'd give this a try one night. He didn't use his inhaler once. One Allegra, and he was fine. No itching, no sneezing, no tightening of his chest. He slept through the night like a baby. Stayed two nights in a row with no problems. Pollen has started early here, and I have zero issues. That's never happened. This is an incredible purchase, and you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great at spraying oil and grease from its motor into the room
customer_reviews.text: As far as filtering the air this product is alright, and I didn't find the noise to be unacceptable. But what I have noticed is a large amount of oil or grease leaking out from around the motor. It's flung out into the room by the fan, which is also covered in oil, and you can see where it's run down the inside of the unit from openings around where the fan motor is installed.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Jolley

customer_reviews.title: Only thing keeping me breathing.
customer_reviews.text: I have asthma that's triggered by pet dander. Just added a husky to my house of two ragdolls this year and it put the hair over the "able to breathe" limit--even steroids and steroid inhalers weren't touching it, and I was coughing and having mild but near-constant asthma attacks all year long no matter how much I vacuumed. Bought this thing and ran it on high for a few days and noticed the cough lessening. I've kept it on low/medium for about two weeks now and my cough is completely gone. Highly recommend for asthma sufferers!
customer_reviews.author: horsetails90

customer_reviews.title: Good product, but a little help.
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was great-------until I got a couple of Winix with similar specs. The Honeywell is quiet, but the Winix are quieter. The Honeywell has two stages of filters, the Winix have three, including washable first-stage pre-filter. This eliminates a lot of the debris which ends up on the carbon filter in the Honeywell. Nothing wrong with the Honeywell; it's a great product and is doing a fine job in my living room.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Casowitz

customer_reviews.title: Dust allergy better
customer_reviews.text: Seems to capture a lot of dust. Photo of First filter with cover open
customer_reviews.author: catherine shreve

customer_reviews.title: UNREAL!
customer_reviews.text: 10 minutes after my husband plugged this baby in, the entire bedroom smelled like a team of professional cleaners came through! I couldn't believe it. I thought it was in my head but my husband said the same thing. I have severe allergies and post nasal drip and we have two cats and a large dog (not smart, I know, but we love them). The first night, we both had much improved sleep. I didn't wake up with tearing eyes or cough throughout the night. As soon as I went downstairs, I started sneezing so it looks like we will have to buy another one! Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Angela M.

customer_reviews.title: DID NOT WORK KEPT TURNING OFF
customer_reviews.text: Worked great.... for the 4 days it ran. Then it stopped working. I’d turn it on and it shut off within the next few seconds. Every. Time. After. That. We even tried multiple outlets in the house to see if that made a difference. We turned it off and unplugged it and let it rest for over 24 hrs and tried again. Same thing happened. It was maddening as the the purifier was nearly $200 and I bought it for my husband’s terrible allergies. Now we have to start from scratch and find another one to get......... not happy with this purchase at all.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Cox

customer_reviews.title: Liked first one so much we bought another
customer_reviews.text: Liked first one so much we bought another. Very effective and relatively quiet. Have them running 24x7. When you change the filter it’s surprising how much dirt it cleans from the air. We’re having wildfires right now and outside air is really bad ... inside if fresh. Not sure if it helps much with COVID-19 but it can’t hurt. Sorry to read some have experienced issues with faulty or broken units but we haven’t after more than a year. But if we did I’d buy another in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Woodward

customer_reviews.title: packs a punch
customer_reviews.text: pros--sturdy, strong fan, night dimmer, sucks air from front and sides (so you can place unit against a wall) cons--touch controls a bit finicky... tips--noise is ymv, but not as bad as I thought it would be given its size...level 2 (general) seems about as loud as a small window air conditioner. turbo is definitely turbo loud, and level 3 is in between (ok for starters but likely too loud for overnight use)..people complain about all the HEPA filters (3) but lots of generics are out there and unlike some units they only need replacement annually.
customer_reviews.author: King doey iii

customer_reviews.title: Worst air filter I've had
customer_reviews.text: 3 months later still emits an eye and throat irritating plastic smell. I noticed other reviews mention it as well. I have no clue how this thing has so many good ratings. I wonder if they are fake. I have to find a way to return this.
customer_reviews.author: Sergio

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: This product is junk! Died a week after warranty expired, 30 days. Amazon makes it as difficult as possible to do the right thing! I'm very disappointed in the quality of your customer service! Trying to deal with them,is a lesson in Frustration! Amazon, make it right!!!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Chesterton

customer_reviews.title: toxic smell and we have had it for weeks.
customer_reviews.text: 2 stars because I am not sure if it does the job yet. It smells so strongly of toxic that I can't tolerate it on in the house. I took off the plastic from the filters so that is not the problem.
customer_reviews.author: valueforbabe

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had bought this a long time ago!
customer_reviews.text: We have cats and dogs, and two of the cats had shown signs of asthma; that was before we got this air purifier. Almost immediately we noticed a decline in their breathing issues, and now going on 2 months I haven't heard them have any issues inside, and one is a strictly inside cat. My house smells cleaner also. We had stopped with air fresheners because of the cats also, but we don't need them now. I couldn't be happier. It sounds like a fan running, but I have it on the highest setting and running nonstop, and that doesn't bother is at all.
customer_reviews.author: BZRanch

customer_reviews.title: Great Hepa Air Purifier
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this and 2 other Honeywell air purifiers in 2013. This unit has run 24/7 since then. It's only turned off when the pre-filters are being vacuumed (every month) or changed (every three months) or the hepa filters are being replaced (every year). I have felt so much better and it really sucks up all the pet hair and dust. The white noise makes sleeping easier as long as it's set in anything other than turbo.
customer_reviews.author: Lefty

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Equipment.
customer_reviews.text: Augh-pull my hair out. I have had this for 4 months. It'll light up but that is it. It won't run period. I have sat on the phone for 1 1/2 hrs trying to get through to anyone, no luck. 200 + dollars down the tubes. Ya can't return it if ya can't get help. Do not buy this. Impossible to get service to answer you.
customer_reviews.author: Sunny

customer_reviews.title: Loud clunking noise as soon as I turned it on for the first time
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to try this purifier to help with allergies. Imagine my utter disappointment when I turn it on and it makes this amazingly loud clunking noise on the turbo setting. And on the other settings it sounds like it is not working at all. And yes, I unpacked according to manual , removing the plastic from the filters before turning it on. Returning item.
customer_reviews.author: C. Pascual

customer_reviews.title: IT BROKE IN 3 weeks
customer_reviews.text: I hate to be that guy, but i read the reviews and thought "mehh", these people are just misusing the product. BOY WAS I WRONG. I handled this device like it was a new born child, following every instruction and recommendation. Alas, I tried to turn it on 3 weeks later and it wouldn't turn on. I had a technician look at it and his words were; WHO SOLD YOU THIS CRAP. I replied, i bought it on amazon and it was NEW! ..... NOT WORTH IT .. don't be like me. read the reviews and make up ur mind but be warned.
customer_reviews.author: dawgin

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, good air flow but a little noisy
customer_reviews.text: Just out of the box, I like it. Looks sleek, fits well within a room doesn't draw too much attention and it's not too... Too loud. Best put on gentle setting when operating in if you're watching something that might be a little more quiet. Product is in great condition otherwise and I look forward to seeing how it works with our young pup.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Todd MML

customer_reviews.title: Ours died after a few weeks of use!!!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how to get a hold of the seller, but we just bought about 10 of these and I haven't been in the office to use all of them, but the one we had been using for a few weeks is dead. It turns on but nothing happens besides some of the lights lighting up. I am not sure if this one is just defective or what is going on! However, I am outside my return window so I am out now a couple hundred dollars!! If anyone know how to get a hold of the seller, please let me know. This is just crazy to happen so quickly and not be able to return.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Feaster

customer_reviews.title: Health and Housekeeping
customer_reviews.text: Cleaning out the filter after three months, I was amazed at how much dust this machine sucked out of the air. I always knew my home accumulates a lot of dust which is the main reason I purchased the unit, but I'm amazed I didn't get asthma or emphysema years ago as it looked like a powder snowfall when I opened the cover to check filter. I keep the setting on General Clean which creates an ambient noise that is non-offensive, or even soothing. Only negative is that it's not attractive as a piece of furniture or accessory, but any lack of aesthetic is more than made up for in benefits from housekeeping to health.
customer_reviews.author: Davis61

customer_reviews.title: Loved it but not the whining noise the motor was doing
customer_reviews.text: This really was a nice unit, but after just a couple days of running (only when home and at night ) it started to make a whining noise in the motor . If you tilted the unit it would stop ,put it back to how it is supposed to stand it would start the noise again . Item was sadly returned ....
customer_reviews.author: Eric P Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great while it lasted...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product in August and I loved it at first! It works great at removing pet odors and the dust in my house has decreased in just a few short weeks. However this product is already making terrible noises like it’s on its last leg, so unless u have over an extra 200 bucks to shell out every three months I would not recommend this product. I’m so disappointed with the quality of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Improves air quality.
customer_reviews.text: Fairly quiet and cleans the air. Helps with our allergies and reduces dust in the house. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth

customer_reviews.title: Toxic Smell
customer_reviews.text: The smell coming out of this purifier is overwhelming. It burns my nose and throat. I'm worried it may be hazardous to my health.
customer_reviews.author: Alirena

customer_reviews.title: I have two now
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these now. These are great. They use generic HEPA filters that you can get from a number of sellers on Amazon. This large model cleans the air very nicely with minimum white noise. I've owned my previous one a year now, and it makes such a difference for reducing allergens. You want this particular model because it takes 3 HRF-R3 HEPA filters and a pre-filter that catches larger dust. I can't believe how much cheaper this is compared to other much more expensive HEPA filters that use proprietary filters. Don't do proprietary filters. This unit will greatly reduce your allergens in your house. It's made such a difference for my wife and I.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Thomason

customer_reviews.title: Perfect and Daily Use for 3 years!
customer_reviews.text: I run this on low 24/7, and only bump it up if I'm cleaning and stirring up dust. I change the outer filter quarterly, and by then it has collected a lot of dust and pollen. I tap loose dust from the inner filters quarterly and change them once a year. This air filter works great at getting rid of any smoke and smoke smells from my downstairs neighbor, as well as other allergens. I have tons of allergies, but I love to have the windows open, so this takes care of keeping the room free of indoor and outdoor allergens. It has been going strong for 3 years, just logged on to buy more filters.
customer_reviews.author: TrulyJulie

customer_reviews.title: Some units are defective, just exchange for a good one. The good ones are really good.
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased a 2nd Honeywell HPA 300 - it has saved us during numerous bad air days in the past year. Experience with defective units: The very first unit I received was defective - the motor oil smell fumed the room when I turned it on. Amazon promptly shipped me another one upon request for an exchange, and the 2nd one turned out to be perfect. Quiet, efficient, and everything Honeywell promised. Please do make sure you have a good warranty system (i.e. if you happen to receive a bad one, you have a way to exchange it easily.)
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: This is wonderful for clearing smoke out of the air!
customer_reviews.text: I had to ship this to a relative that then shipped it to me in California. I now have 3 of these and bought one for my daughter. The extra shipping was expensive but that's not that product's fault. For some reason I couldn't get it shipped to California which was somewhat ironic.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love This!
customer_reviews.text: My son recommended this after he'd bought one and I'm so glad I bought it. It's so quiet you can barely hear it, I love the 3 options for germ/allergen, general clean and turbo (very helpful during the smoke from the CA fires), touch control makes it easy to use and filters are easy to replace. It cleans the air quickly and gets rid of "stale" air or smoke. Note: It's a good idea to buy some back up filters at the same time (nice to have on hand)
customer_reviews.author: LINDA B

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: Wow I live in a very large half basement and all I can say is it must be good for a way larger room than advertised because I stired up a large amount of dust today and within 15 minutes I could only see a few particles of dust floating around in the sun beams coming through the windows and the pre filter was filthy from it all. I'm very impressed. My allergies have improved substantially since placing it in my room.
customer_reviews.author: Trent

customer_reviews.title: This is outstanding if you live in CA near the fires.
customer_reviews.text: My house was smelling like smoke, my central heat and air filter turned black in just one week with the fires in the area. I opened the box and took the plastic off of the filters and turned it on. Wow, The turbo clean freshened the air in the entire house. My house is 1,000 sqf. So I did close off the bedrooms until the air was clean. then I opened one door at a time to clean the whole house. I am thinking of getting another one for the other half of the house.
customer_reviews.author: Ami

customer_reviews.title: Two words.. FIRE HAZZARD!!!
customer_reviews.text: Had this thing for 90 days when one night i smelled what seemed like wires burning. It was my new $228.00 Honeywell. The fan was stopped and humming and the unit was getting hot. Filters were clean so that was not the issue. This thing has no overload or overheat protection. Very dangerous. Just glad it happened before i fell asleep.
customer_reviews.author: ktm690

customer_reviews.title: 10/10 Recommend
customer_reviews.text: ITS NOT THAT LOUD AT ALL on turbo mode, and I have sensitive hearing. I love it so much I want another. Really good filtration with instant results. Love that it sucks from the front and blows air up. BEST!
customer_reviews.author: Jus Be

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but it's big and ugly
customer_reviews.text: We have three dogs and three kids, so our house can get kind of smelly. Many of us also have allergies and we live in Arizona where the air is dry and there's a lot of dust in the air. I bought this in hopes of helping our house smell cleaner, and taking less allergy medicine. It's worked on both fronts. The only reason I didn't give it five stars is because it's giant and pretty ugly to look at. I had to find a corner to hide it in.
customer_reviews.author: Rbash

customer_reviews.title: Works wonders for allergens! 5 stars!
customer_reviews.text: Never new I had allergies to cats until I got one and then at that point it was too late the family was attached. I did an extensive search for the best/economical choice air purifier. This was by far the best choice and has given so much relief that words can’t explain! I was skeptical if an air purifier would really help and it truly does you can also feel the difference in air quality aside from the allergy aspect. I highly recommend and I am not one to do reviews on products. 5 stars across the board & no I didn’t receive a discount of any such to review the product.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin J.

customer_reviews.title: It works.
customer_reviews.text: This Honeywell air purifier works well for my allergies. It's quiet enough, easy to use, and I would buy it again. The only thing I would change is the same thing I would change on all air purifiers, the filter size. My wish would be that they used a standard small size hepa furnace filter instead of specialty filters. For what it's worth I also own a much more expensive purifier and the Honeywell is probably better.
customer_reviews.author: P. Sinn

customer_reviews.title: Falls apart
customer_reviews.text: Whenever I brush the unit with my pant leg or I move the unit, panels flop off dumping the filters. Instead of it being where it can do the most good I have to keep it out of the center of the room. It's utter nonsense to pay this much money for an appliance and it can't even stay in once piece. I've got similar problems with other Honeywell appliances (an evaporative cooler) I'm going to avoid this company.
customer_reviews.author: W. N.

customer_reviews.title: Bad design  flimsy  plastic  horrible  oil odor
customer_reviews.text: Smells like wd40 honewell really went down hill on this unit flimsy plastic $200 is not cheap 3 filters say it all they didn't even make a filter for it they take filters from other units irritates eyes when on called trouble shoot ran 5 times what they said no change but eyes worst and running nose I have honewell well 160 tower that is great different filter design that nothing get past and filter design 10x better. The 2 $55dollar eureka worked better I just didn't like tio2 on filters uv light but they worked .
customer_reviews.author: tommyc

customer_reviews.title: Not Sure about this
customer_reviews.text: I live in a very small studio...less than 500 sq. feet. Running on the Turbo setting for the entire week, I can still smell Monday's cooking. And, I'm still sneezing and full of allergies. It seems well made, it's a little noisy on high settings, and it does seem to move a lot of air around. I'm just not sure it is doing what it is supposed to. I'm going to give it a little time and see if I really notice anything.
customer_reviews.author: jones

customer_reviews.title: NICELY REMOVES SURROUNDING SMOKE ODORS.
customer_reviews.text: IN JACKSON WYOMING AND THE THE LOCAL FIRES PLUS THE INTENSE DRFT OF SMOKE FROM CALIFORNIA,OREGON, WASHINGTON AND IDAHO - "TURBO SETTING" (WHEN OUT OF HOUSE AS THE ASSOCOATED NOISE LEVEL IS MUCH HIGHER) CLEANS THE AIR IN THREE ROOMS QUITE WELL. THE THREE FILTERS ARE GOOD FOR THREE MONTHS WHICH IS ABOUT THE TIME THE BACK ORDER FILTERS SHOULD MAKE IT FOR REPLACEMENT.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy R Nelson

customer_reviews.title: i really like it. seems to keep the air clean of ...
customer_reviews.text: i really like it. seems to keep the air clean of normal household smells. i live in an apartment above another that was built in the lates 70's and not constructed very well. long story short new neighbors moved in and they smoke cigarettes and other things like freight trains and the smells waft up through the floor. I turn this machine on turbo and it helps some. I am sure it is not intended for this purpose. I still like it for the general air cleaning and it functions well on all 3 settings. it is pretty quiet except on turbo but really not louder than any other fan or window air conditioner on high.
customer_reviews.author: sharong

customer_reviews.title: Buy this air cleaner.
customer_reviews.text: The best air cleaner we have now. Works great, very quiet. I havent used tbe remote. But this unit is great, clears the air in our living room, dining room and kitchen area. My husband has asthma and this was really helpful with all the smoke from the fires. Highly recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pet allergies gone!
customer_reviews.text: This HEPA air filter is amazing!! I had read some reviews about a chemical smell coming from some of the units and that must be a few faulty ones because ours is working great. No chemical smell at all. There is virtually no dust to wipe from surfaces. It will do a large room easily. We purchased this because we got a dog and my wife has allergies. It helped so much. We have had it running pretty much constantly for 3 months. Highly recommend. The only negative I could say is when it’s in turbo mode it’s a bit loud but it’s because it’s doing some serious work.
customer_reviews.author: Randall

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product! I just bought 2nd unit for my office.
customer_reviews.text: This unit is quite powerful, especially on the turbo setting. I don’t find the sound of it running intrusive. It doesn’t have all the bells and whistles of some units, which is fine by me. It cleans the air, and many add on the features some units have are irrelevant or likely to fail. I am impressed enough to have just ordered another unit for my office.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I love this unit. It’s not too noisy. Like after a few minutes you get used to it running. I have THREE cats in my apartment and one sheds like a stressed out mother. The filter catches most of the fur that’s floating in the air. The air quality is soo much better. I used to cough and sneeze all the time. Now I can breath so much better. When you first walk in the house... it smells soo much fresher. I’m recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Been running for 2 years like a beast
customer_reviews.text: I've had this product for almost two years now. I live it continuously on, 24/7 except for sometimes when I'm taking an important call (white noise sometimes gets picked up by the mic). I've had 0 issues with it, and it keeps my room smelling empty. I can't stand smells or strong perfumes, which makes this an amazing buy. It's a little noisy, but it's easy to deal with. I have had no issues sleeping with it, and honestly my keyboard is louder.
customer_reviews.author: Paras

customer_reviews.title: Off gassing of the filters should be expected. Yuck
customer_reviews.text: Smelt like a direct delivery from polluted China. It took several days for the pollution to offgas. Gave me slight headaches, something I thought it would alleviate.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene Meisenhelder

customer_reviews.title: Allergies
customer_reviews.text: I think it’s a great product and definitely improves the air quality but the noise can be a little much at times especially if you need it on the allergy setting like me because I have bad indoor and outdoor allergies but it’s not as bad on the lower setting which is what I keep it on during the day then turn it up at night because I have it in the living room. I also don’t care for the touch controls it’s very finicky some times it start at the slightest touch and other times you have to actually tap it but overall it works and I can breath a lot better and that’s the important thing
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous85

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly effective, great design.
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this beast removed so much dust from the air in our basement that I hadn't even realized existed. I expected it to run for months without needing a prefilter cleaning, but in just 30 days, there was significant accumulation on it. We're pretty much clean freaks, so this was fairly impressive. For the price, there can't be a better one out there. Pulling the air in through the front and out the top is genius, it addresses the room that it's in directly. I don't understand how some designs pull the air in through the back, as that's usually the part facing a wall or other barrier.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Hanley

customer_reviews.title: So disappointing in so many ways.
customer_reviews.text: Never assume. I bought the Honeywell purifier as a gift because I wanted a high quality product. Imagine my disappointment when upon turning it on i heard a fan hitting something inside the device. Click, click, click. I guess when you get big enough, quality becomes less of a priority. Very Sad. Honeywell is definitely not an essential business.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Cleans the air, dries under boobies! Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! Not only does it clean the air, but I can turn it on turbo boost and stand over it after I get out of the tub to dry under my boobs. That is worth A LOT in this gulf coast heat!
customer_reviews.author: J. Jones

customer_reviews.title: WASTE OF TIME AND MONEY
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure what is wrong with these air purifiers. I bought one and stopped working after a few days I received it and asked for a replacement. Got the replacement and a few days later the new one stopped working again!!!! It will not turn on. I've tried EVERYTHING! What is going on with them? $200 dollars of a product that doesn't work? At this point I can't even return this anymore. I am very upset!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Forest fires of doom PNW 2020
customer_reviews.text: I bought this machine right before the Pacific Northwest turned into Mordor in 2020. I can say without a doubt in my mind that it performs admirably! I did turn the filters into a yellow mess in only one week and have already replaced them, but unless you live inside an active volcano I doubt that will happen with much frequency.
customer_reviews.author: Jason E. Domann

customer_reviews.title: Bought a 2nd one 2 years after the first
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this air filter, which swallows smells as well as pollen. We have bought 2 over the last 3 years and been very pleased. When we first placed it in our bedroom it sounded a little loud, but we no longer notice the sound at all -- it disappeared from conscious perception in 2 or 3 weeks. We're now planning to buy a third unit of this model to expand the coverage in our home.
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: Allergy relief finally
customer_reviews.text: Love this purifier has made a huge difference in my allergies. I run it 24 - 7 and bought an extended warranty. One of the top rated on consumer reports for my price range. I would recommend this product. Filter replacements are decently priced
customer_reviews.author: Marsha

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: I had no idea how dirty our air was until this product. It’s amazing!! I saw a lot of complaints about noise but honestly after a short time you are used to it completely and don’t even notice it. To me it’s worth it for clean air. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Sub

customer_reviews.title: does wonders combating cat hair and allergens
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING! Something about the airflow in my apartment means an hour after cleaning, all surfaces were cat hair central once again. After getting this there is such a huge improvement. I'm not waking up with a scratchy throat and my allergies are much better. The "turbo" function is pretty loud understandably, but I'm in love with this filter
customer_reviews.author: February Anastaszja Wall-Brown

customer_reviews.title: These WORK,. we have 5 dogs and people are amazed at how much better our house smells.
customer_reviews.text: We had our doubts about these doing anything really helpful for us, but were needing to try something. THEY WORK! My husband's allergic reactions have been cut down A LOT. The first one we bought was a bigger size for our home office, but we have since bought this smaller one for our bedroom and one for my mom's room as well. I'm a believer and now I want a big one for the frontroom/family room.
customer_reviews.author: Diana John Jamerson

customer_reviews.title: Good investment in healthier air
customer_reviews.text: The higher pollen count this year was making me very uncomfortable. Bought one of these for my bedroom and no more stuffy nose, itchy mouth or runny eyes. Not quite as quiet as I would like but I adjust it down to the lower level when I am sleeping and it is fine. Then I turn it back to high during the day to decrease contaminants in the room. I also have a cat that I am allergic to and this filter has helped with dander too. A good investment in healthier living. Need to get one for the family room too.
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: This Air Filter does an excellent job cleaning the air
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son who was coughing all the time while in his condo. After he used for a few days he is not coughing any more so the air is definitely cleaner. He mentions that is noisy so he turn it to a low speed while in the room and before leaving his condo he turns it up. I believe the HPA 300 is a very good value. My son claims his unit did not come with a remote control. So far we are very happy with our pourchase and we have been recommending it to our friends that have respiratory issues
customer_reviews.author: Luis S.

customer_reviews.title: Major design flaw
customer_reviews.text: The openings in the grill on the top are like an open invitation for toddlers to shove random crap inside. Unfortunately, there is no way to get inside to clean it out. I even called Honeywell and they told me they couldn’t help me without breaking it. If you have children, I recommend covering the unit in mosquito netting or buying a different unit entirely.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren S.

customer_reviews.title: ... for a couple of hours and the room smells terrible and although we turned it off and opened doors ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to get rid of allergies and ran it for a couple of hours and the room smells terrible and although we turned it off and opened doors and windows I could not sleep because my chest hurt so. Called the manufacturer and they said that was "highly unusual" and suggested we ship the unit to them for testing. I am glad to see other users with the same reaction. Sending it back!
customer_reviews.author: Joan Gibb Engel

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy. Defective product. Read the reviews.
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY. Please listen to the other 1 star reviews before purchasing this product. I was very happy with the air purifier for the first few weeks. After about 3 weeks of use I noticed that it had slowed down and was moving a lot less air. I checked the filters to see if they were dirty and there was no reason for it to be moving air slowley. Today, it has stopped working all together. It was delivered to me on April 8, today is May 24. I will be returning the product.
customer_reviews.author: William Sherrer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: They work well but are only quiet on lowest setting.
customer_reviews.author: PFT

customer_reviews.title: Great for allergy induced nighttime asthma!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has asthma, which we finally figured out is triggered at night by airborne allergies. She would get congested and have breathing problems at night, often needing her emergency inhaler without much relief. Once she got this air purifier in her bedroom and started running it every night on Turbo, her nighttime asthma attacks went away! This is worth it's weight in gold for her. I would highly recommend trying it if you or someone you love has nighttime asthma issues related to dust, ragweed, or other airborne allergies.
customer_reviews.author: Greeny

customer_reviews.title: Smells but convenient design and fairly quiet.
customer_reviews.text: I love the easy to open panel for the filters. It’s quieter than I anticipated. However, I’m disappointed that it produces an oily smell. Plastic meets WD40 mild yet irritating kind of smell. So, what’s done is done. I hope the smell goes away.
customer_reviews.author: Just Another Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this air purifier.
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrible air purifier given the fact it stopped working after a month. Very shoddy piece of equipment and I highly recommend no one purchase this! It is a Honeywell product and I expected it to give me the protection it is advertised for. Also, beware that the return window closed and it looks like I'm out of $216.58. I didn't want to give a star at all, but my review won't post with out a rating.
customer_reviews.author: Fata

customer_reviews.title: Best product of this type.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second unit of this model that we have purchased. This model runs quietly and works effectively for a large area. This most recent purchase was not without a problem. We received a defective unit that would not run. After a couple of telephone calls, Amazon was very responsive and sent a replacement unit that was received two days later. We highly commend Amazon for exceptional customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Lars

customer_reviews.title: Made our allergies disappear.
customer_reviews.text: My partner and I are renting a home and every morning since we moved there we would wake up with stuffy noses, sneezing, and with itchy eyes. We initially thought it was the different flora in the new state we had moved to, but I noticed we didn't have these allergy symptoms at work, or while biking to and from work! So I thought it might be something in the home causing us problems. I bought two of these, one for the living room and one for the bedroom and it made our symptoms disappear immediately. Now we wake up feeling normal, no itchy eyes, no stuffy noses! What a relief.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Problems right out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: I really need this air purifier for my increasingly severe allergies. I did hours of research over a period of weeks before finally deciding to purchase this model and I am very disappointed that it sounds like it has a piece of plastic stuff in the fan or something isn't aligned correctly inside because it makes an awful clicking sound in the Allergy mode I desperately need. I should probably send it back to get a new model, but I REALLY need the relief so I don't know what to do. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: craig pfaff

customer_reviews.title: Replacement filters not available
customer_reviews.text: Works fine until it’s time to replace the pre-filter (3 months), then you’re SOL. There are no pre-filters that fit this thing, Honeywell doesn’t seem to even know what size it uses, as I’ve yet to find any version of a replacement filter that is the same size as the one it originally came with.
customer_reviews.author: J. Walter Weatherman

customer_reviews.title: Defective unit
customer_reviews.text: Everythign was fine with this unit, Installed filters as directed. Turned the unit on and it ran fine for about 8 hrs then it stopped workin, Contacted Honeywell and they said I needed to show proof of purchase. I turned around and contacted Amazon to return the unit since i bought from them, tooka bout 30 mins on the phone to set up the return and still dont have my refund. I wont buy another one of these, you would think for the price it would be way more dependable
customer_reviews.author: Tony Hyde

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS
customer_reviews.text: So far this has been a god send.. We put up a new house and have been "clogged up" for over a year now. This eliminated it almost in one night. We have a very large room with a master retreat and this doesnt have any problem cleaning the air in all spaces. I did a lot of research before my purchase and was willing to spend 1K on a good purifier and im glad i didnt. This one had the best reviews EVERYWHERE not just amazon and I definitely agree!
customer_reviews.author: Jayney B

customer_reviews.title: Runs but does not remove any dust.  Snow White filters after 6 months of continuous use on high.
customer_reviews.text: I ran this air purifier for 6 months and I checked the filters periodically. Always clean filters yet the room is dusty. It’s at the point now where the red light reminding me to change the filter stays on and I can’t find any way to turn it off. It has become another item in my room that I need to dust regularly. It has not removed an ounce of dust and it leaves an odd odor. What an expensive waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: NauticalDiva

customer_reviews.title: Clean, fresh air
customer_reviews.text: I noticed a difference in the air quality of my apt within 24hrs. Much fresher. I cough and sneeze significantly less. It also cleans the air from the smell of cooking so it won't linger for hours. The germ and general clean settings are fairly quiet, although allergen and turbo are rather loud. I feel that turning up the television is a small trade off for clean air in my home.
customer_reviews.author: Bridgette Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Does not filter smoke or smells
customer_reviews.text: I replaced the outer carbon filter and it still does not filter smoke. It does suck in lots of dust and allergens but don't rely on this to filter smoke. I was practically hugging this during the height of the wildfires and it just spread the smoke around.
customer_reviews.author: Howler R.

customer_reviews.title: Really clears out the forest fire smoke
customer_reviews.text: Living in Southern Oregon has some challenges, like being enveloped whole summers in smoke from huge forest fires. We already had a smaller Honeywell for our den, and a large filter system for our bedroom, but our large living room and dining/kitchen area made it necessary to get a least one more filter. Considering the size of the area just mentioned, we probably should have gotten at least one more. Nevertheless, the improved air quality was noticeable. The smoke smell was gone and my allergies calmed down.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel N. Lionsden

customer_reviews.title: Works amazing glad we bought it
customer_reviews.text: Don’t know why some others are complaining. We placed this in our 9 month-old’s room because he was coughing a lot. There was no bad smell and it works great. I had also looked at some competing units, and saw one that looked very nice. They claimed to be a USA company and the address on their website was bogus. I’m glad we have this a try. We’re very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonAddict

customer_reviews.title: Great Unit
customer_reviews.text: Immediately felt the difference in air quality after running this unit only ten minutes in our bedroom. The multiple speed settings are nice and the unit is very quiet on the lowest setting. Honestly didn’t think it would make such a difference in the air quality in our home and glad we purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Dog hair and debris!
customer_reviews.text: We have a dog, we live in the woods, lots of trees lots of pollen lots of allergies, this thing may not clean your entire household airspace but atleast its filtering some of it so your nose doesn't have to! I think these HEPA filters are doing way more than some people give them credit for, when the sun shines through the window on a bright day I could always see so much dust floating around, but I swear nowadays I can barely see anything floating in the air on those same sunny days. Thanks Honeywell!
customer_reviews.author: Cristoff McGroff

customer_reviews.title: It makes noise, but doesn't do much else
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for about 8-9 months now. I run it in my dining room 24/7, which is an area of about 250 square feet . I can't say that this air purifier has made any improvement whatsoever in my house. I have 2 cats so I keep this near the dining room closet where the liter box is. It does nothing to remove the litter box odor and there's just as much dust and dander around as there was before I bought this. I'm beginning to think the only thing this paper weight is good for is consuming electricity.
customer_reviews.author: evmoore

customer_reviews.title: WORKS WELL
customer_reviews.text: I love this air purifier. I live in an RV with my cat and dog. Both of them feel the need to shed. I had also been too sick to clean for a few months. I turned the purifier on medium for 4 hours and the air and surfaces are all clean. Since then I’ve done a light dusting and it’s still clean. It’s been a month and all is going well.
customer_reviews.author: cris111

customer_reviews.title: Helped with my allergies on day 1
customer_reviews.text: Got mine recently (will write a long term review later). The machine is a bit loud but in a white noise type of way so you could fall asleep to it. On the first night, I noticed the change with my allergies because i was able to breathe from both nostrils and I didn’t wake up with any itchy/puffy eyes as I have been. I had to buy this after having a Christmas tree in my house for the first time. It has helped considerably the quality of my air and I can feel myself able to relax at home and not flaring up or congested
customer_reviews.author: melissa

product_meta.title: Honeywell HPA300 True HEPA Air Purifier, Extra-Large Room, Black
product_meta.description: Color:Black| Design:PurifierHoneywell True HEPA Allergen Remover captures up to 99.97 percent of microscopic allergens, .3 microns or larger. Note air purifier is starting to make noise and the air output is less then the filters may be dirty. High amounts of contaminates can block the pores in the filter and stop the air from moving through it, recommend replacement of filters.
feature_bullets: Extra large room air purifier: Recommended for extra large rooms (465 square feet) this true hepa allergen remover air purifier helps capture up to 99.97% of airborne particles as small as 0.3 microns.

Turbo clean: With 3 air cleaning levels plus a Turbo clean setting, this air purifier helps remove particles like pet dander, pollen, dust, mold & smoke. It also helps capture certain germs & reduce odors.

Honeywell air purifiers: Our air purifiers help remove allergens, dust & odors. If you have allergies, pets or stale indoor air, air purifiers help remove airborne particles & help improve air quality.
Filter & circulate: Honeywell Air Purifiers filter & circulate air in the stated room size up to 5 times an hour. Breathe easy knowing the air in your home is fresher & cleaner with fewer allergens.
Honeywell quality: Improve your air quality & neutralize odors for a clean & healthy breathing experience year round with Honeywell replacement filters for air cleaners & purifiers.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars5,356 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
